      Business Intelligence Developer 
      
        Summerset Group Holdings Limited is one of New Zealand's largest and most respected operators in the aged care sector and is listed on the NZX and ASX. We design, build and operate retirement village's right across New Zealand. We are proud of our dynamic work environment and an equally diverse workforce.
        We are looking for an exceptional Business Intelligence Developer to join our Finance team!
        What will your responsibilities be?
        Reporting to the Business Intelligence Manager, you will be responsible for developing end to end business intelligence solutions, from meeting with stakeholders to delivering a final product and training the end users. This includes developing and maintaining systems for databases, undertaking documentation processing and carrying out analysis projects as required.
        What are we looking for?
        
          BSc/BA in Computer Science, Bachelor of Information Science (Systems) or related field
          Proven experience as a BI Developer in the industry, 3+ years preferred
          Experience using tools (SSIS, SSAS, SSRS)
          SQL Server 2017
          Experience using Power BI and writing advanced DAX queries
          Experience writing advanced SQL and performance tuning
          Preferred experience in UAC, database management and tuning
        
        What's in it for you?
        You will be working with an enthusiastic and caring team that is fun to be part of. Our aim is to create a great employee experience, to collaborate to find ways to improve, and to support each other. We also offer a competitive salary and a range of benefits on offer including day-to-day Health insurance, professional development opportunities, an annual entitlement of Summerset shares, wide range of supplier discounts, long service leave, a day off on your birthday and much more!  
        If this sounds like you or someone you know, then we would love to hear from you! Please note that this role may close early due to an increased number of applications - apply as soon as possible to avoid disappointment.
        Please note due to NZ Immigration requirements we are obliged to consider candidates that already have the right to work in NZ for this role first. Due to this we may not be able to support a visa application for this role.

        The Client You will be working as a part of a group of companies who believe in providing excellent customer service and products. These are based in the Finance industry.           You will contribute to finance projects - in-house and client-based. 
          Contribute to customizable development of systems based on the Jade platform. 
          Opportunity to directly interact with vendors and contribute to business decisions. 
          Work as a part of a laid back culture, which promotes flexibility. 
          Assist in on-going new ways of working; adapting Agile methodology.

          At least 3-5 years of experience in a Software Development background (Microsoft Technologies) 
          Experience with Jade development 
          Experience with UAT and unit testing 
          Prior experience working in Waterfall and Agile environment 
          Finance knowledge/background would be ideal 
          Excellent communication skills 
         Benefits 
        
          Flexible working hours 
          Training and development opportunities 
          Be a part of an ongoing transformation 
         If the above description sounds like you, please hit 'APPLY' to submit your CV. Please Note: Full NZ Working Rights are required for this role.

companyName: Beyond Recruitment - Winner – Best Innovation –2018 Global Recruiter Awards
description:
Solution Architect/Lead Developer Skip to contentTry the SEEK app to find your dream job faster.Try the appNo, thanksSEEKAustralia’s #1 job siteShow user menuShow user menuMenuJob SearchProfileSaved SearchesSaved & Applied JobsApplied JobsRecommended JobsSettingsSign in or RegisterEmployer SiteCoursesSign in or RegisterEmployer siteJob SearchProfileCareer AdviceJobsCoursesBusinesses for saleVolunteeringAUNZSolution Architect/Lead Developer More jobs from this companyJob DescriptionJob HeaderSolution Architect/Lead Developer Advertiser: Beyond Recruitment - Winner – Best Innovation –2018 Global Recruiter AwardsMore jobs from this companyJob InformationJob Listing Date29 Sept 2020LocationBay of Plenty, TaurangaWork TypeFull TimeClassificationInformation & Communication Technology, Developers/Programmers



  
    
      Solution Architect/Lead Developer 
      
        
          Solution Architect/Lead Developer
          Tauranga
          Flexible working options
        
        About the role:
        The Solution Architect/Lead Developer is responsible for working with the development teams, providing technical advice, architectural guidance to deliver high quality solutions for customers.  This role does not have any HR responsibilities.  The role is focused on the technical implementation, design, and delivery of solutions. The role is envisaged to be made up of 25% architecture, 25% presales support / prototyping / 50% hands on development as part of the team.  You will be part of the senior technical team and report to the Head of Development.
        Skills required for this role:
        
          5+ years of solid hands-on experience in Microsoft C#, ASP.Net (Web Forms & MVC), .Net Core, MS SQL AND / OR Java Spring, Spring Boot, PostgresSQL etc
          Solid knowledge of databases and data structures used in modern web and mobile application context
          3+ years of experience designing and working with API driven applications
          3+ years of solution architecture experience
          Good understanding of client-side languages, technologies and practices; HTML, CSS, JavaScript, jQuery, AngularJs and or React JS, W3C compliance and accessibility experience
          Cloud Architecture experience with AWS and or Azure cloud platforms
          Solution Architecture experience
          Experience designing scalable, cloud first solutions
          Experience with event and messaging systems (RabbitMQ, Kafka, SMS, SQS)
          Solid experience in continuous integration and automated deployment
          Excellent understanding of software development methodologies, including KISS, DRY and SOLID
          Excellent attention to detail
          Strong communication skills in all disciplines including written, oral, email and presentation
          Capable of hands on problem-solving, with ability to generate ideas and solutions
          Ability to travel to client sites where required
        
        We'd love to hear from you, if this is the right role for you - APPLY now or contact Clare Saunders on 09 374 0876 or Mignon Green on 027 582 1129 or a confidential discussion.
        Please note that you must be located in New Zealand to be considered for this contract role. 
        Ref: 105963
        Beyond Recruitment - Technology, Transformation & Digital, connecting IT talent with IT opportunities. Visit www.beyond.co.nz for more roles and information.

name: Front End Engineer
description: Front End EngineerSkip to contentTry the SEEK app to find your dream job faster.Try the appNo, thanksSEEKAustralia’s #1 job siteShow user menuShow user menuMenuJob SearchProfileSaved SearchesSaved & Applied JobsApplied JobsRecommended JobsSettingsSign in or RegisterEmployer SiteCoursesSign in or RegisterEmployer siteJob SearchProfileCareer AdviceJobsCoursesBusinesses for saleVolunteeringAUNZFront End EngineerMore jobs from this companyJob DescriptionJob HeaderFront End EngineerAdvertiser: Kernel WealthMore jobs from this companyJob InformationJob Listing Date30 Sept 2020LocationAuckland, Auckland CentralWork TypeFull TimeClassificationInformation & Communication Technology, Developers/ProgrammersKernel is a financial services company on a mission to change the financial future of millions. We believe the key to financial freedom is a diversified portfolio of investments that are transparent, low-cost and accessible. Using great tech and innovative ideas, Kernel provides a unique customer experience to deliver the information, tools and products necessary for investors to reach their long-term financial goals. What sets us apart is the real human responsiveness you might have not thought imaginable from an online investing service.   Our team is working together to build one of the most innovative fintech companies in the world and we’re looking for talented people to join the adventure. If you’re someone who wants to help us move fast, ship often and make a huge impact, read on and get in touch.  You can read more about the Kernel mission here and our investing ethos here.Role Summary:You will be responsible for delivering high-quality, engaging user experiences, through your knowledge of the latest Front-end Technology, and have working knowledge of React/Vue and Typescript.You will work closely with the product management and design teams to ensure the technical feasibility of UX/UI design, establish and promote code guidelines and ensure high quality implementation of designs and brand consistency.You will become an integral part of a growing team, who has ambitious plans to deliver a world-class financial technology product. This is a tremendous opportunity to take a digital product from discovery into production, with the opportunity to define the choice of technology and strategy along the way.You’ll Have:   Experience delivering commercially viable applications with the latest frontend technologies such as React/Vue and Typescript. Experience with automated test frameworks such as Cypress, Jest and Enzyme Experience with CI/CD pipelines Experience working with agile methodologies and fast pace environments An exceptionally good eye for design and awareness of user interaction Experience with design tools such as Sketch, Figma, XD Excellent communications skills and an ability to communicate effectively to both technical and non-technical team members Nice to Have:  Experience in the Financial Services industry Experience with React Native or other mobile technologies Ability to read, review or develop in backend technologies Up-to-date with latest UI/UX trends, techniques and technologies If this job sounds like you, please send through a cover letter explaining why you’re excited about this role and working at Kernel, along with your CV.  Why Kernel?At Kernel, we embrace difference. We create a safe space where all voices can be heard so that we can all do our life’s best work. We’re committed to promoting and celebrating diversity and believe getting the best outcomes requires diverse perspectives.  We are willing to challenge the status quo, we prioritise long-term thinking and values over short-term incentives. We offer a range of family friendly employment policies, flexible working, wellbeing initiatives, an awesome office spot in Auckland CBD and all the social vibes!We want you to grow with us. We’re a high growth company and you’ll form a core part of an innovative and collaborative team. As Kernel grows, you’ll have the opportunity to take on new challenges, extend your skill set and take on more responsibilities.The application form will include these questions:Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in New Zealand?Which of the following programming languages are you experienced in?Which of the following front end development libraries and frameworks are you proficient in?What's your expected annual base salary?How much notice are you required to give your current employer?Report this job advertBe carefulDon’t provide your bank or credit card details when applying for jobs.Learn how to protect yourself here.Report this job ad Share this roleJob ApplyApply for this jobSave jobSend jobJob InformationJob Listing Date30 Sept 2020LocationAuckland, Auckland CentralWork TypeFull TimeClassificationInformation & Communication Technology, Developers/ProgrammersApply for this jobToolsJob searchProfileRecommended jobsSaved searchesSaved jobsApplied jobsCareer AdviceDownload appsiOSAndroidSEEK sitesEmployer siteSEEK AUCoursesBusiness for saleVolunteeringCompanyAbout SEEKNewsroomInvestorsInternational partnersBdjobs — BangladeshBrighterMonday — KenyaCatho — BrazilJobberman — NigeriajobsDB — SE AsiaJobStreet — SE AsiaJora — WorldwideOCC Mundial — MexicoWorkana — Latin AmericaZhaopin — ChinaJora — AustraliaPartner servicesSidekickerConnectHelp centreContact usWork for SEEKProduct & Tech BlogSEEK videosSocialFacebookInstagramTwitterYouTubeEmployersRegister for freePost a job adProducts & pricesCustomer serviceHiring AdviceNewMarket InsightsNewRecruitment software partnersPrivacyTerms & ConditionsProtect yourself online© SEEK. name: Site Reliability Engineer - Full Stack Developer
description:
Site Reliability Engineer - Full Stack DeveloperSkip to contentTry the SEEK app to find your dream job faster.Try the appNo, thanksSEEKAustralia’s #1 job siteShow user menuShow user menuMenuJob SearchProfileSaved SearchesSaved & Applied JobsApplied JobsRecommended JobsSettingsSign in or RegisterEmployer SiteCoursesSign in or RegisterEmployer siteJob SearchProfileCareer AdviceJobsCoursesBusinesses for saleVolunteeringAUNZSite Reliability Engineer - Full Stack DeveloperMore jobs from this companyJob DescriptionJob HeaderSite Reliability Engineer - Full Stack DeveloperAdvertiser: Open PolytechnicMore jobs from this companyJob InformationJob Listing Date27 Sept 2020LocationWellington, Hutt ValleyWork TypeFull TimeClassificationInformation & Communication Technology, Developers/Programmers



  
    
    
      Site Reliability Engineer - Full Stack Developer 
      
        iQualify is seeking an experienced Site Reliability Engineer - Full Stack Developer who wants to be part of a successful and fast growing ed tech product. This role can be based in Lower Hutt or remotely.
        We're discovering how to make the world's most engaging vocational learning experience every day for hundreds of New Zealand businesses and hundreds of thousands of learners. Join the team that builds iQualify, New Zealand's fastest growing social learning platform.
        Backed by 70 years of distance learning experience by The Open Polytechnic, New Zealand's specialist provider of open and distance learning, from certificate to diploma and degree level, and is internationally recognised in its field.
        What's the role?
        We are looking for an experienced Site Reliability Engineer (SRE), to join a broad product team with roles ranging from UX, visual design, learning design, customer experience and software developers.
        What you'll need:
        
          Extensive experience as a Full Stack Developer
          Experience in production monitoring and service improvement
          Experience in developing and delivering automation systems
          Extensive programming experience in web application development technologies including Angular, Node JS, Javascript, CSS, HTML(5)
          Experience with database application design and development in NoSQL and document data stores
          Experience working within a team in applications development
          Experience with effective use of development platforms and tools
          Good experience with cloud platforms
          Experience with lean, agile and XP development practices
        
        We are looking for someone who:
        
          Is right at home troubleshooting and diagnosing potential issues. Diving into the technical detail is your thing
          Has experience working with software platforms and tools to make people's lives easier
          Has well-developed problem solving skills - you'll need these every day
          Is able to think proactively, anticipate problems and work with team members to implement innovative solutions
          Has plenty of opinions about how to make things better
          Is a results-orientated approach to initiative
          Has great relationship building skills
          Loves working with users to analyse, define and document requirements and specifications
          Has excellent verbal and written communication skills that you'll demonstrate by writing an outstanding cover letter showing us why you're the person we're looking for. Wow us with your style.
        
        What's in it for you?
        
          We provide a supportive and creative place to work developing learning solutions that help learners and our partners succeed.
          We're equipped with coffee and frequent pet visitors.
          We're located out in the Hutt Valley if that's a bonus for you, or you can work from anywhere within NZ
          You'll be challenged and supported and be an integral part of a team developing the world's most engaging social learning platform.
        
        Still interested? We're keen for you to interview us. Hit the apply button.
        Applications close midday Wednesday 7 October 2020. Please note only online applications will be accepted.
      
      
      
    
    
    careers.openpolytechnic.ac.nz

name: Developers (Intermediate & Senior) - Platform Engineering
description: Developers (Intermediate & Senior) - Platform EngineeringSkip to contentTry the SEEK app to find your dream job faster.Try the appNo, thanksSEEKAustralia’s #1 job siteShow user menuShow user menuMenuJob SearchProfileSaved SearchesSaved & Applied JobsApplied JobsRecommended JobsSettingsSign in or RegisterEmployer SiteCoursesSign in or RegisterEmployer siteJob SearchProfileCareer AdviceJobsCoursesBusinesses for saleVolunteeringAUNZDevelopers (Intermediate & Senior) - Platform EngineeringMore jobs from this companyJob DescriptionJob HeaderDevelopers (Intermediate & Senior) - Platform EngineeringAdvertiser: XeroMore jobs from this companyJob InformationJob Listing Date22 Sept 2020LocationWellington, Wellington CentralWork TypeFull TimeClassificationInformation & Communication Technology, Developers/ProgrammersXero is a beautiful, easy-to-use platform that helps small businesses and their accounting and bookkeeping advisors grow and thrive.  At Xero, our purpose is to make life better for people in small business, their advisors, and communities around the world. This purpose sits at the centre of everything we do. We support our people to do the best work of their lives so that they can help small businesses succeed through better tools, information and connections. Because when they succeed they make a difference, and when millions of small businesses are making a difference, the world is a more beautiful place. Our Platform Engineering teams are looking for talented software developers to join us in Wellington. We need people to help us move forward and stay ahead of the curve. This is a fantastic opportunity to step up - we deal with billions of requests each day, and there are very few roles of this scale in New Zealand.   About the team: Xero’s Platform Engineering group is responsible for building and maintaining critical applications and services consumed throughout Xero globally. We write and maintain services central to keeping Xero online and scaling to millions of customers We’re a team that enjoys putting on a lot of different hats; our typical technical work is a mix of software development, architecture, and infrastructure as code. We’ve worked hard to make the process of delivering and supporting our code as frictionless as possible. We pride ourselves on our emphasis on software performance and scalability, our desire to innovate and improve the way we work, and our commitment to writing quality software.   How you’ll make an impact: You’ll help us scale to meet the demands of a million-plus global customers and you’ll help decide on the tools and approaches we use. At Xero, continuous improvement is something we focus on each and every day. We’re all about rapid release cycles, continuous integration and delivery.   Some of what you'll do:  Develop robust, high quality software to meet the agreed specifications and in line with our development team standards and procedures. Assist product architects and product specialists with the design and prototyping of software. Your technical solutions and ideas will contribute to the team backlog and help drive the platform to service the needs of other product teams. Work with your team to build a culture of constant improvement and increased automation Maintain current knowledge of Microsoft, AWS and other development technologies used in the development of Xero’s software applications. Mentor and train others in your team and encourage a collaborative workspace for your peers to excel Identify and promote opportunities to extend and enhance our solutions and Xero’s development standards. Give and receive honest constructive feedback Most importantly, have fun on this journey   What we're looking for:  We’re looking for someone who has a passion for technology and continuous improvement, and enjoys a collaborative approach to software development. We also value someone who can share that knowledge and grow other people in the team. We’d love to talk to you if you have a mix of some of the core skills below. You don’t need to know everything - having some of these areas of expertise is great and we can teach you the rest. C#, .NET, and software development best practices AWS or other cloud services Continuous integration and deployment practices Building and monitoring scalable platforms A passion to explore and use new technology/approaches to solve problems Working with Linux ASP.NET, MVC & APIs Familiarity with Test-Driven Development/Behaviour-Driven Development   Why Xero? At Xero we support many types of flexible working arrangements that allow you to balance your work, your life and your passions. We offer a great remuneration package including shares plus a range of leave options to suit your well-being. Our work environment encourages continuous improvement and career development and you’ll get to work with the latest technology.   Our collaborative and inclusive culture is one we’re immensely proud of. We know that a diverse workforce is a strength that enables businesses, including ours, to better understand and serve customers, attract top talent and innovate successfully. We are a member of Pride in Diversity, in recognition of our inclusive workplace. So, from the moment you step through our doors, you’ll feel welcome and supported to do the best work of your life.   Xero is an NZ Immigration Accredited Employer and Rainbow Tick certified too. Please include a cover letter in your application, telling us why you’re a great fit for this position.Right to live and workYou must have the right to live and work in this location to apply for this job.Report this job advertBe carefulDon’t provide your bank or credit card details when applying for jobs.Learn how to protect yourself here.Report this job ad Share this roleJob ApplyApply for this jobApplications for this role will take you to the advertiser’s site.Save jobSend jobJob InformationJob Listing Date22 Sept 2020LocationWellington, Wellington CentralWork TypeFull TimeClassificationInformation & Communication Technology, Developers/ProgrammersApply for this jobApplications will open the advertiser’s site.ToolsJob searchProfileRecommended jobsSaved searchesSaved jobsApplied jobsCareer AdviceDownload appsiOSAndroidSEEK sitesEmployer siteSEEK AUCoursesBusiness for saleVolunteeringCompanyAbout SEEKNewsroomInvestorsInternational partnersBdjobs — BangladeshBrighterMonday — KenyaCatho — BrazilJobberman — NigeriajobsDB — SE AsiaJobStreet — SE AsiaJora — WorldwideOCC Mundial — MexicoWorkana — Latin AmericaZhaopin — ChinaJora — AustraliaPartner servicesSidekickerConnectHelp centreContact usWork for SEEKProduct & Tech BlogSEEK videosSocialFacebookInstagramTwitterYouTubeEmployersRegister for freePost a job adProducts & pricesCustomer serviceHiring AdviceNewMarket InsightsNewRecruitment software partnersPrivacyTerms & ConditionsProtect yourself online© SEEK. name: Senior Software Engineer
description:
Senior Software EngineerSkip to contentTry the SEEK app to find your dream job faster.Try the appNo, thanksSEEKAustralia’s #1 job siteShow user menuShow user menuMenuJob SearchProfileSaved SearchesSaved & Applied JobsApplied JobsRecommended JobsSettingsSign in or RegisterEmployer SiteCoursesSign in or RegisterEmployer siteJob SearchProfileCareer AdviceJobsCoursesBusinesses for saleVolunteeringAUNZSenior Software EngineerMore jobs from this companyJob DescriptionJob HeaderSenior Software EngineerAdvertiser: Orion HealthMore jobs from this companyJob InformationJob Listing Date1 Oct 2020LocationAuckland, Auckland CentralWork TypeFull TimeClassificationInformation & Communication Technology, Engineering - Software



  
    
    
      Senior Software Engineer 
      
        Healthcare is experiencing a global shift, opening up exciting new opportunities in technology. In the world of software engineering, there are few areas where you can have more impact. Your work will assist doctors, lab techs, pharmacists, nurses, and others involved in helping patients improve their health. The products you work on play a material role in saving lives and improving patient care, and the quality of those solutions is key.
        If you are a Front End developer with experience in the JavaScript ecosystem (React, Angular, Webpack, Node, CSS3, HTML5), with knowledge of Python and Java, have developed in both on prem and cloud environments (preferably AWS), and know Kubernetes from Kafka, we would love to hear from you.
        Within this role you will enjoy using your extensive experience working on greenfield development to actively create the future of leading health software products and solutions.  As an experienced developer you have gone through enough failures and successes in projects to make you technically stronger than many of your peers, which is evident in the way you approach challenging problems.
        Focusing on future tech you will be creating a machine learning smart data platform that will stand the test of time.  This project will ultimately be a tool kit that will pave the way for the future of innovation in technology. Building on domain driven design principles you will be part of a team who builds, installs, monitors and runs so you’ll have full accountability and, with access to customers, you can integrate quick feedback loops as part of the process.
         
        Orion Health's Success Story:
        We are an energetic, vibrant, and adventurous New Zealand company with a global reach; we have employees, offices, and customers all over the world. Our award-winning solutions are utilized by leading health organizations. Using the latest technologies to develop health software, we make a positive difference in people's lives.
        The result of your work will be used in over 25 countries, making a difference to thousands of lives, available on all possible devices with millions of people relying on it daily!

description:

    Software Engineer II - Operational Data 
    
      About Rocket Lab Rocket Lab is the global leader in small satellite launch. Our mission is to open access to space to improve life on Earth. There are endless possibilities for what we can achieve with better access to space, and that access is now a reality thanks to Rocket Lab. Our team is 500 people strong and we’re adding to it every week. Collaboration is at our core - every idea is heard, and everyone makes a difference. Teams are nimble, decisions are made quickly, and we are action-oriented.    While other companies talk about it, we do it!    Your mission The Electron Launch Vehicle is a fly-by-wire system and generates a large quantity of real-time data throughout the production and launch life-cycle. This data tells a story and lets Rocket Lab engineers and key stakeholders know how we are performing and provides evidence for continuous improvement. The Operational Data software ensures that this valuable information is robustly captured and made available to those who need it most.  An Operational Data Software engineer will provide vision, leadership, technical input and project coordination to the Operational Data Team in support of the Electron launch vehicle and Photon spacecraft.    Essential skills
        
          Tertiary Diploma, Certificate or degree in Software Engineering, Computer Science, Electrical Engineering or demonstrated equivalent level of knowledge.
          Minimum of 3 years experience within a software engineering related discipline
          Experience with Python Development
          Experience with common data analysis libraries/tools such as Apache Spark, SQL, Pandas/Numpy, ETL pipelines
          Experience with Redmine, Jira, Bugzilla, Mantis, or other issue tracker
          Experience with Git
            Desirable skills
        
          Knowledge of data science and numerical analysis techniques 
          C#, Golang, Typescript programming experience
          Experience with Scrum
          Database Application Development
          Networked application development
          Web Application Development
          User Interface Development
         As well as a being a career-defining role, working at Rocket Lab means being part of meaningful projects with world-leading experts.    Collaboration is at our core - every idea is heard, and everyone makes a difference.    We get things done. Our team is nimble, decisions are made quickly, and we are action oriented. While other companies talk about it, we do it. This means projects get the green light faster and ideas are put into practice rapidly.    Everyone works on the big stuff. This isn’t a huge aerospace company where you get lost in bureaucracy and end up a tiny cog in a giant machine. At Rocket Lab, your work directly impacts the success of each mission. Everyone’s voice is heard, and everyone can contribute major projects. This is your chance to play a pivotal role in developing space systems that change the way we access space.    Important Information  For security reasons background checks will be undertaken prior to any employment offers being made to an applicant.  These checks will include nationality checks as it is a requirement of this position that you be eligible to access equipment and data regulated by the United States' International Traffic in Arms Regulations.  Under these Regulations, you may be ineligible for this role if you do not hold citizenship of Australia, Japan, New Zealand, Switzerland, the European Union or a country that is part of NATO, or if you hold ineligible dual citizenship or nationality.  For more information on these Regulations, click here http://www.pmddtc.state.gov/regulations_laws/itar.html.
      
      Ciara Byrne

This is your chance to play a pivotal role in developing space systems that change the way we access space.    Important Information  For security reasons background checks will be undertaken prior to any employment offers being made to an applicant.  These checks will include nationality checks as it is a requirement of this position that you be eligible to access equipment and data regulated by the United States' International Traffic in Arms Regulations.  Under these Regulations, you may be ineligible for this role if you do not hold citizenship of Australia, Japan, New Zealand, Switzerland, the European Union or a country that is part of NATO, or if you hold ineligible dual citizenship or nationality.  For more information on these Regulations, click here http://www.pmddtc.state.gov/regulations_laws/itar.html.Report this job advertBe carefulDon’t provide your bank or credit card details when applying for jobs.Learn how to protect yourself here.Report this job ad Share this roleJob ApplyApply for this jobSave jobSend jobJob InformationJob Listing Date20 Sept 2020LocationAuckland, Auckland CentralWork TypeFull TimeClassificationInformation & Communication Technology, Engineering - SoftwareApply for this jobToolsJob searchProfileRecommended jobsSaved searchesSaved jobsApplied jobsCareer AdviceDownload appsiOSAndroidSEEK sitesEmployer siteSEEK AUCoursesBusiness for saleVolunteeringCompanyAbout SEEKNewsroomInvestorsInternational partnersBdjobs — BangladeshBrighterMonday — KenyaCatho — BrazilJobberman — NigeriajobsDB — SE AsiaJobStreet — SE AsiaJora — WorldwideOCC Mundial — MexicoWorkana — Latin AmericaZhaopin — ChinaJora — AustraliaPartner servicesSidekickerConnectHelp centreContact usWork for SEEKProduct & Tech BlogSEEK videosSocialFacebookInstagramTwitterYouTubeEmployersRegister for freePost a job adProducts & pricesCustomer serviceHiring AdviceNewMarket InsightsNewRecruitment software partnersPrivacyTerms & ConditionsProtect yourself online© SEEK.     .NET Developer 
    
      
        An awesome SaaS startup in Wellington is heading into their first round of recruitment, and looking for a senior level C# ASP .NET developer. With that comes the opportunity to get elbows deep at an early stage, where you can have huge exposure and work directly with a very strong technical leadership team. Seriously punching above their weight in ID and credential management, they have been recognised by both Microsoft and the NZ energy industry, bringing huge opportunities in both execution and market share.  Digitising a manual training records process, they bring a huge amount of additional support, security and confidence to the energy industry, with a scalable SaaS application with heaps more space to grow. Locally built, and backed by a big player in the global ID market, they have the best of both worlds, small enough to make a difference and with the scope to be something really special.     What will I be doing?
          
            Support and enhance our API to be easily consumable for client integrations by multi-language environments such as JavaScript, Java, Python, PHP, etc
            Development and enhancement of our data interfaces for Credential Management Systems and Learning Management Systems (Salesforce, Microsoft Dynamics etc)
            Diagnosing and resolve API, integration data and code issues
            Continuously improve our API and integration solutions
            Documentation for our API SDK
           What do I need to know?  
          
            They are a .Net shop so knowledge of C# will be essential so you can read the code and can contribute to discussions. For this role, specialist knowledge of .NET Core, WebAPI, Dapper ORM, SQL Server, HTML/CSS, PowerShell and cryptography will be required
            Contemporary knowledge about API/REST interfaces (such as using Swagger) including modern authentication such as OpenID and Oauth utilising JWT, JWS
            Write and refactor C# code, SQL queries, data access code, API validation code
            Familiarity with modern code management, build pipelines and tools with Azure DevOps and Git being our primary toolset for this
            Microsoft Azure services in general such as App services and functions for serverless applications. Knowledge of Azure Service bus would be an advantage
            Data exchange standards, formats and schemas such as JSON Schema, web hooks etc
            Self-motivation, pragmatism and simplicity – you love working in a fast-paced environment and understand how to balance competing priorities and understand the benefits of delivering value to end users in an iterative manner
           We’d love to see some of this, but it’s not a dealbreaker
          
            Knowledge of Identity standards such as W3C Verifiable credentials, DID and any wider knowledge of the self-sovereign identity ecosystem 
            Prior experience working within a front-end environment built on React or a similar modern JavaScript framework would be advantageous. Even more of a bonus if you have done any work with Web Assembly; including PWAs and Blazor 
           If you want to work in a tight, high performing team with some cutting edge technologies and a project with a huge future, then drop us a line here or email peter@talent.army to set up a discreet chat.

description:

      C# Software Engineer - Azure - Contract 
      
        
          Global industry, ongoing contract
          Big Data - Christchurch based
          Agile, Flexible, Lean, Grow
        
         
        Who is hiring:
        Our client is a global provider of services to a broad industry base, including large government and corporate clients. They have a well-established local cross functional software team and are working on a new revolutionary software product that will soon become one of their flagship service offerings.
        They are expanding their local team and are seeking to appoint a Software Engineer into either permanent or contract position. The role is a mix of new product development, integration and maintenance of existing products and platforms. This is an exciting opportunity for an intermediate Software Engineer to join a truly global team and become part of a revolutionary product development that will set the benchmark for Azure based data solutions.
        This role is ideally Christchurch based and applicants are expected  to either move to this location for the term of the contract or spend at least a couple of days a week in the Christchurch office.
         
        What you will need: 
        Ideally they are looking for experience in most of the following:
        • Programming and testing ability in multiple technology stacks
        • C#. Net / Core
        • SQL
        • Implementing in Azure using Kubernetes.
        • Developing and deploying with Azure DevOps
        • Terraform
        It would be desirable if you were familiar with:
        • Big Data technologies such as Spark, Hadoop, Kafka
        • Functional programming concepts and experience with Scala
        • Java object-oriented analysis, design, and implementation
        • IP networking, common network components and internet protocols
        Apart from the technical skills required you need to be enthusiastic, self-motivated and tenacious to deliver on their product and customer commitments. You also need to have the desire to work in a fast-paced team environment with ability to meet tight deadlines.
        What’s in it for you?
        You are in at the ground floor of one of the most exciting Australasian service offerings from this global client. Having this high profile project on your portfolio will open doors at international level.

description: Software EngineerSkip to contentTry the SEEK app to find your dream job faster.Try the appNo, thanksSEEKAustralia’s #1 job siteShow user menuShow user menuMenuJob SearchProfileSaved SearchesSaved & Applied JobsApplied JobsRecommended JobsSettingsSign in or RegisterEmployer SiteCoursesSign in or RegisterEmployer siteJob SearchProfileCareer AdviceJobsCoursesBusinesses for saleVolunteeringAUNZSoftware EngineerMore jobs from this companyJob DescriptionJob HeaderSoftware EngineerAdvertiser: Vital SoftwareMore jobs from this companyJob InformationJob Listing Date24 Sept 2020LocationAuckland, Auckland CentralWork TypeFull TimeClassificationInformation & Communication Technology, Engineering - SoftwareOverviewVital is software for hospital Emergency Departments & patients. We use AI to reduce length of stay, save millions by increasing doctors’ and nurses’ productivity, and keep patients safe & happy. There are more than 500 million visits to the ED every year in the US. Our goal is to improve the healthcare experience for these patients.We are building a mission-focused, inclusive, and motivated team to scale our product to more patients. Based primarily in Auckland, New Zealand we also have offices in Atlanta and New York. Vital is backed by prominent investors in healthcare, and founded by Aaron Patzer and Dr. Justin Schrager.As a Healthcare Software Engineer at Vital, you will develop and launch cutting-edge products, using the best technologies available. We have a strong DevOps culture, excellent CI/CD tooling, an agile approach, and a commitment to a microservice architecture. We are completely cloud-based. We make use of event sourcing, distributed systems, immutable data structures for persistence and graph databases for modeling patient flows.RoleYou’ll be responsible for building and maintaining the backend systems that allow us to process and store medical data, and those that allow us to expose that data for frontend consumption.You'll have a good understanding of scalability; you’ll use systems thinking to diagnose and solve performance problems as they arise.Reliability is critical at Vital, and you’ll be working on a live production system directly used by both expert healthcare providers and their patients.RequirementsMost of our requirements are flexible for the right candidate:Knowledge of US Healthcare systems is integral to this role. Familiarity with covered entities, HIPAA, BAAs, healthcare insurance providers, Billing Codes, and ESI triage methodology is crucial.Knowledge of various Health Level 7 (HL7) methods is also crucial, as you’ll be expected to handle integration with various US Healthcare Systems. Multiple years experience dealing with ADT feeds, and FHIR is necessary.We are looking for senior engineers with experience in maintaining web applications, preferably at scale, with high performance and volume. We’d like you to have several years of software engineering experience.Experience in Scala, and modern Java, is essential. Our systems handle millions of transactions, so we’re looking for candidates with experience handling large amounts of transactions.Because of our need for high reliability and scalability, the right candidate will have strong fundamentals in Software Engineering/Computer Science. For example, you should have a good understanding of the performance of algorithms at scale, and be able to communicate this in Big-O notation.As our product is developed for the American market, experience in US healthcare and health-care related technologies, such as integrating with Electronic Health Record systems, is essential.Other than the above, we’d like you to demonstrate passion and drive toward your engineering work, and toward the prospect of making a real difference in healthcare.Experience in Javascript, or providing APIs to stateful client-side applications.Experience in GraphQL, Postgresql, AWS data services such EKS or Aurora, Kafka, Akka, Slick, or any of the other software we happen to use currently.The right candidate will take initiative to get things done, embrace uncertainty and work well in a team of other high-performing engineers.Who You AreHave passion and drive for software engineering.Possess a strong bias towards getting it done. You take initiative and don’t need to wait for permission.Comfortable with, embrace, and thrive in uncertainty.Work well with other, high-calibre team members.BenefitsAs a startup, a role at Vital gives you the opportunity to get in on the ground floor of a rapidly growing company, where you can have a large impact on our engineering culture.
